# Question

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is the Julia code to solve your problem:

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    # Lowercase column name
    col = lowercase(col)
    
    # Replace any spaces or hyphens with underscores
    col = replace(col, " " => "_")
    col = replace(col, "-" => "_")
    
    # Strip leading and trailing whitespaces
    col = lstrip(rstrip(col), '_')

    return col
end
```
This function takes a column name as input (`col`), transforms it according to your specifications (lowercasing, replacing spaces/hyphens with underscores, stripping leading and trailing whitespaces) and returns the cleaned column name.
